instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
No liquid damage and board looks pristine. No audio even though sound can be adjusted from keyboard and under sound output MacBook Pro Speakers are listed as built in.

When playing a YouTube video the timer for the video progresses along with the captions but the video itself remains frozen with no sound.

What should be checked next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Any change when you plug headphones?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Yes video plays fine and sound works when headphones are plugged in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> lines.

Compare diode mode readings around audio amplifiers with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> diode 0.284

<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> diode 0.284

no good board here to compare readings

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Just in case, save data and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: 1.8V should be good; pay atention to end "_L".

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101802, member: 682"]
1.8V should be good; pay atention to end "_L".
[/QUOTE]
So right - stupid me...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: No change after successful DFU restore with no errors

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Connect at least one known good speaker.

Should be really strange to have all audio amplifiers bad.
